newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Details of Czech GDP for first half 1996.
newsitem.headline: Details of Czech GDP for first half 1996.

text.p: The following is a quarterly breakdown of Czech gross domestic product (GDP) for the first half of 1996, as released by the Czech Statistical Bureau (CSU) on Wednesday.

Note. All figures are subject to revision. All results measure percentage change for period, year-on-year, except where listed as being in crowns. All percentage changes, and total amount listed in real, inflation adjusted terms.
The CSU changed the methodology for calculating the inflation adjusted real amount in billions of crowns at the beginning of the year. All figures use 1994 as a base.
The CSU has not released the real percentage changes for 1995 re-calculated using the new methodology. Nominal 1995 figures using the new methodology -- 1989 was the previous base
REVISED 1995 CZECH GDP Q1 Q2 Q3 Q4 1995

Note. Above inflation adjuseted figures use new methodology with 1994 prices as the base. Deflator used for 1995 real gdp results was 10.1 percent, compared with 7.9 percent for the first quarter and 9.1 percent for the second quarter 1996.
Czech 1995 GDP, using the old methodolgy grew 4.8 percent, with growth of 3.9 percent in the first quarter, 4.0 percent in the second quarter.
